sections.title: Welcome to the SmartUrbanity Profile Questionnaire
sections.description:
SmartUrbanity is a European research and innovation project launched in 2025 to support the transition toward more sustainable, accessible, and people-centered cities. By promoting active travel, shared mobility, and integrated public transport, the project aims to reduce car dependency and emissions while improving access for all.

 This questionnaire helps us understand your background, daily travel habits, and comfort with different mobility options. Your responses will guide our analysis of mobility patterns collected later through digital tools and participatory activities. Participation is voluntary and anonymous. Your information will be used solely for scientific and educational purposes within the SmartUrbanity project.

 https://www.smarturbanity.com/about

sections.title: Tell us about yourself
sections.description: Questions about age, gender, education and work. They help describe who our participants are.

questions.text: What is your age group? (Participation is limited to adults aged 18 or older)
What is your gender?
Do you have any condition or limitation that affects your ability to move independently?

options.text: Yes, I have a temporary condition/limitation
Yes, I have a permanent mobility condition/limitation

questions.text: How many adults, including yourself, live together in your household?
Do you currently live with any dependents (such as children, elderly individuals, or others who rely on you for care)?
Which economic status do you think best describes your household?

options.text: Can cover basic needs but have little left over
Comfortable, can afford most things I need
Very comfortable, can afford extra expenses

questions.text: Which best describes your employment status?
Do you currently work remotely (partly or fully)?
What is your highest completed level of education?
Do you have a pet at home?
Do you currently hold a valid driving license?
Do you belong to any of these groups?

sections.title: Access to vehicles and parking facilities
sections.description: This section gathers information about the availability of vehicles and parking options to better understand your transportation access and needs.

questions.text: Do you own or have access to any of the following in your households?
Do you regularly use any of the following in your households?
Do you have access to parking spaces near your residence?
Do you have access to parking lots for bikes near your residence?

sections.title: Travel behaviour and mobility choice
sections.description: This section explores your travel habits and preferences to help us understand how you choose and use different modes of transportation.

questions.text: Which travel mode do you most often prefer for your trips?
Do you regularly use any combination of the following modes in the same trip? Thick all those you use.
How often do you use shared mobility services (bike-share, e-scooter)?

options.text: I never use shared mobility services.

questions.text: If you were given free access to a shared bicycle or e-scooter, would you use it?
How expensive do you think it is to ride a bicycle or e-scooter?
What would motivate you to use sustainable travel (walk, bike, shared mobility) more often?

sections.title: Mobility confidence and digital engagement
sections.description: This section assesses your confidence in using different mobility modes and your comfort with digital tools that support travel.

questions.text: How confident are you riding a bicycle in your city?
How confident are you riding e-scooters in your city?
How comfortable are you with using apps for transport (e.g., route planning, ticketing)?

options.text: I don't use it at all.

questions.text: How strongly do you feel that you belong to, are part of, or have a relationship with the people and place where you live?
Which of these best describes you?

options.text: I travel here regularly for work or study (Commuter)
I’m here temporarily for another reason (Visitor)

questions.text: In which Municipio of Rome do you currently live?
Which Municipio of Rome do you travel in most frequently (your main activity area)?
Which is the second Municipio you travel in most frequently?
Which is the third Municipio you travel in most frequently?

By promoting active travel, shared mobility, and integrated public transport, the project aims to reduce car dependency and emissions while improving access for all.

 This questionnaire helps us understand your background, daily travel habits, and comfort with different mobility options. Your responses will guide our analysis of mobility patterns collected later through digital tools and participatory activities. Participation is voluntary and anonymous. Your information will be used solely for scientific and educational purposes within the SmartUrbanity project.
